intro: Pavetta napieri, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, often arranged in clusters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture. Pavetta napieri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
